channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2023070929
item.description:
Report X-2023070929

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: SPARROWS POINT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND AT HOT STATION WET AND LEAKING. THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: THE TOP ON THE CONTAINER WAS LOOSE CAUSING THE LIQUID TO SPILL OUT OF CONTAINER. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: FOLD ABSORB WAS USED TO MITIGATE SPILL AND PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN TOTE. THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED UNDER VENTALTION SYSTEM.

DescribePack: THE PLASTIC JUG WAS CRUSHED AND THE CAP CAME LOOSE CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023070722
item.description:
Report X-2023070722

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023070722 SequenceEvent: ARRIVED FROM PREVIOUS FACILITY WET WITH BOX FALLING APART DescribePack: ONE OF THE LIDS WAS LOOSE RESULTING IN APPROX 1/3 GALLON LEAKING. BOX TOO BIG WITH NO PACKING MATERIALS USED DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN LINED TOTE FOR PROCESSING. 2. X-2023070806 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED FROM PREVIOUS FACILITY WET AND FALLING APART DescribePack: 1 LID WAS COMPLETELY LOOSE RESULTING IN 3/4 GAL LEAKING. BOX WAS COMPROMISED AND OTHER BOTTLES FELL FROM PKG. A SECOND BOTTLE WAS CRUSHED RESULTING IN ANOTHER 1/2 GAL LEAKING DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN LINED TOTE FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023070650
item.description:
Report E-2023070650

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: JESSUP
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one large battery (un2794) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 2 quarts of acid. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023070527
item.description:
Report E-2023070527

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: ELKRIDGE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While freight was being temporarily stored on the loading dock, forklift operator wasn't paying attention to the clearances of his forklift and hit a pail with the forkblades of his forklift consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbents and placed into a recovery container as was the damaged pail.
